greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Length of the run of consecutive equal digits in the decimal expansion of Pi beginning at position n and ignoring any immediately-previous equal digits.
example: Pi = 3.141592653589793238462643383279502884... and the first run of 2 starts at position 25, so a(n) = 1 for n < 25, a(25) = 2.
Runs of length 2 begin in positions 25,35,45,60,80,95 then not again until 118. Compare A049514 and A049518.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 12 2003
ext: More terms from Kyle Hoffman (khoffma1(AT)ashland.edu), Apr 01 2004
Definition clarified by _Rick L. Shepherd_, Aug 26 2006
